title: Volvo XC40 Recharge: all-electric power for Telegraph readers' favourite car, due in 2020
text:
Volvo has released the first details of its battery-powered XC40, the Swedish company’s first fully electric car and the first model of its Recharge line-up of solely plug-in cars. Based on the 2018 European car of the Year winner, the XC40 Recharge has a total system output of 296bhp and a claimed range of more than 249 miles.

The first examples are expected to arrive in the UK in late 2020. Pricing details haven't been announced, but expect the new model to cost from about £50,000. If that's not tempting enough, it seems that Volvo may well offer every Recharge-badged vehicle with free electricity for a year.

The existing XC40, with a range of efficient diesel- or petrol-fuelled internal combustion...
description: Volvo has released the first details of its battery-powered XC40, the Swedish company’s first fully electric car and the first model of its Recharge line-up of solely plug-in cars.
